Name: Khorovats
Description: Traditional Armenian barbeque made with marinated meat (usually pork, lamb or beef) grilled over hot coals. Served with lavash bread, tomatoes, onions, and fresh herbs.

Name: Manti
Description: Small dumplings filled with spiced ground meat (usually lamb or beef) and served with a garlicky yogurt sauce and sometimes topped with tomato sauce and butter.

Name: Dolma
Description: Grape leaves stuffed with a mixture of rice, herbs, and sometimes ground meat. Served cold or warm with lemon juice and olive oil.

Name: Kufta
Description: Ground meat (usually lamb or beef) mixed with bulgur wheat, onions, and spices, shaped into balls and stuffed with a mixture of spiced ground meat, onions, and sometimes pine nuts. Served with a side of tabbouleh salad.

Name: Lahmajun
Description: Armenian flatbread topped with a mixture of ground meat (usually lamb or beef), tomatoes, onions, and spices, then baked until crispy. Served with a side of fresh herbs and lemon wedges.

Name: Harissa
Description: A traditional Armenian porridge made with cracked wheat and meat (usually chicken or lamb), slowly cooked until the grains and meat are tender and melded together. Served with a side of fresh herbs and lemon wedges.

Name: Khash
Description: A hearty Armenian soup made with beef or lamb feet, slowly cooked with onions and garlic until the broth is rich and flavorful. Served with a side of lavash bread and fresh herbs.

Name: Gata
Description: A sweet pastry made with buttery layers of dough and filled with a mixture of sugar and sometimes nuts or dried fruit. Served with a side of Armenian coffee or tea.

Name: Basturma
Description: Air-dried beef or lamb that has been cured with a mixture of spices, then sliced thin and served as a flavorful appetizer or snack. Served with a side of fresh herbs and sometimes pickled vegetables.

Name: Pakhlava
Description: A rich and sweet pastry made with layers of phyllo dough and filled with chopped nuts and honey syrup. Served with a side of Armenian coffee or tea.

Name: Armenian Salad
Description: A fresh and flavorful salad made with diced tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, and parsley, dressed with lemon juice and olive oil.
